title: Quiz 6: Theatre Nursing Fundamentals
description: History of theatre nursing, legal requirements, theatre layout, and surgical instruments.

questions.question: Who introduced the sterilization of dressings in 1886?
questions.explanation: Von Bergemen introduced sterilization of dressings in 1886. Lister used carbonic acid.

questions.question: What is the difference between a suture and a ligature?

richContent.content:
ItemDescription
SutureUsed to bring tissues together
LigatureUsed to tie blood vessels

options.text: Ligatures use needles; sutures do not
Sutures are only absorbable; ligatures are not
Ligatures are used without a needle to arrest bleeding

questions.explanation: A ligature is a suture material used *without* a needle to tie off vessels.

questions.question: Which of the following are legal requirements before a patient enters theatre? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Patient has eaten a full meal

questions.explanation: Consent, ID, and site prep are mandatory. Patients must be Nil By Mouth (NBM).

questions.question: In Kenya, the legal age for signing a consent form is ___BLANK___ years.
questions.explanation: Those below 18 years are considered minors.

questions.question: Match the needle type to its usage:
questions.explanation: Round bodied pierces (delicate), Cutting cuts (tough), Atraumatic minimizes damage.

questions.question: It is acceptable to obtain informed consent AFTER pre-medication has been administered.
questions.explanation: Consent must be obtained BEFORE pre-medication as drugs may affect reasoning capacity.
questions.hint: Can a sedated person make a legal decision?

questions.question: Order the historical development of anaesthesia:
Why must electrical sockets in the theatre be placed one meter or more above the floor?

options.text: To minimize risk of conducting currents/sparks

questions.explanation: This is a safety measure to prevent explosions/sparks, especially with flammable gases.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of counting swabs and instruments before and after surgery?
questions.explanation: To prevent loss of items inside the patient's cavity.

questions.question: Which forceps are used for holding sponges?
questions.explanation: Rampley forceps are specifically designed to hold sponges.
